posts.post_content:
At my local card shop, this card has been sitting in the EDH display box for about two years now for a dollar. I don't believe human hands have touched it since it was first placed there. No one, not even new folks just starting out in EDH, are suckers enough to buy it. I suspect that's mostly because of the life loss clause.  
I have a single copy of this card. I cannot sell it, I cannot trade it, I cannot give it away. I've tried leaving it in people's backpacks, and they just pluck it out and put it on the table. They don't even spare the effort to throw it away, as if somehow holding onto it for too long will reduce their ability to play Magic.
posts.html:

No one, not even new folks just starting out in EDH, are suckers enough to buy it. I suspect that's mostly because of the life loss clause.
I have a single copy of this card. I cannot sell it, I cannot trade it, I cannot give it away. I've tried leaving it in people's backpacks, and they just pluck it out and put it on the table. They don't even spare the effort to throw it away, as if somehow holding onto it for too long will reduce their ability to play Magic.

Posted By: WarioMan (5/10/2012 11:51:44 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I actually gave this 1/5 instead of 0.5/5, for one reason: Commander. In Commander/EDH, many of its drawbacks are undone by the nature of the format.  
1: The fact that it's legendary is about as much of a drawback as any other legendary permanent in a singleton format.  
2: The fact that you have to pay 2 life is much less of a drawback in a format where your beginning life total is 40.  
3: Even if its mana can only be used for Legendary spells, it can at the very least get your general out of the command zone and onto the battlefield a turn quicker.  
Those three facts are worth half a point to me.
posts.html:

Those three facts are worth half a point to me.

Posted By: Youlose20life (1/29/2011 2:37:27 AM)

posts.post_content:
Let's just call it "*Untaidake, the Fail Keeper*".  
  
Here are five reasons why you should *not* play this card:  
1. Enters battlefield tapped  
2. You have to pay 2 life each time  
3. It only produces colorless mana  
4. Its mana can only be cast for legendary spells  
5. The card itself is legendary  
  
So you get a land with *delayed use* that can only be outside *once* which requires you to *spend* high amounts of *life* while on top of this only produces mana with *very restricted use* which also does *not help* to manage *color issues* at all.  
Oh, and you *can't use* the mana *for* activated or triggered *abilities* either.  
  
Yeah, that's indeed pretty much the worst land ever printed.  
  
What where they thinking when designing and/or playtesting this card?!  
It manages to make [Chimney Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chimney Imp) appear rather playable.  
Even in a legend-themed block like Kamigawa, this card is hardly worth playing with half the amount of re... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Continue (1/11/2013 9:44:10 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I would use it in a legendary deck. 2 Life is not bad, tapped is a hindrance. The real downside is it cant tap for ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol) for other things. But if thats what most of your deck contains, its playable.  
  
Legendary Decks are not something I would play expecting to win every game. Just a deck with singleton copies of a bunch of legendary creatures.   
  
And this land is not bad at all for commander. If you commander ever gets sent back to the command zone, well this can pay his extra fee on its own.  
  
This is not the worst card in the world. You don't want to include this in your land slot. Think of it as a free spell that takes a land drop, that you can use the next turn.
posts.html:
I would use it in a legendary deck. 2 Life is not bad, tapped is a hindrance. The real downside is it cant tap for for other things. But if thats what most of your deck contains, its playable.

Legendary Decks are not something I would play expecting to win every game. Just a deck with singleton copies of a bunch of legendary creatures.

And this land is not bad at all for commander. If you commander ever gets sent back to the command zone, well this can pay his extra fee on its own.

This is not the worst card in the world. You don't want to include this in your land slot. Think of it as a free spell that takes a land drop, that you can use the next turn.

Posted By: TheWrathofShane (10/24/2012 7:11:33 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This land was a part of a triad of pain-abilities in Champions. The other two were [Boseiju, Who Shelters All](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boseiju, Who Shelters All), and [Hall of the Bandit Lord](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hall of the Bandit Lord).  
  
Now, compare those to this: Boseiju is instant's and sorcery's [Cavern of Souls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cavern of Souls), making them uncounterable (minus the any colour business), and Hall is worth it in EDH, since you can have your general gain haste, which is particularly excellent for generals like [Krenko, Mob Boss](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Krenko, Mob Boss) (AKA ones that tap).  
  
And then, there's this.   
  
Thankfully, I've purchased a total of 800 bulk rares, and none of them were this. I got [Gargoyle Castle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gargoyle Castle) and [Contested Cliffs](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Contested Cliffs) though, which aren't great, but they're certainly better than this!
posts.html:

And then, there's this.

Thankfully, I've purchased a total of 800 bulk rares, and none of them were this. I got Gargoyle Castle and Contested Cliffs though, which aren't great, but they're certainly better than this!

posts.post_content:
I went back and forth in my mind from 0-3 stars, and nearly gave it more.   
  
See, the thing is, the only cards to compare this one to are considered mistakes by Wizards.  
  
It produces 2 mana, it costs 0 to play.  
  
[Mana Crypt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mana Crypt) produces 2 mana and costs 0 to play, with almost similar drawbacks. Restricted, Legendary, what's the difference? (If it's not, it should be.) Mana Crypt is busted.  
[Sol Ring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sol Ring) produces 2 mana and costs 1 to play, and it's way more busted than Mana Crypt can ever be, having literally no drawbacks.   
  
The Signets produce 2 mana and cost 2 to play! And Wizards considers them a little overpowered- and..they're right! The Signets make your deck hum like every card in it is hybrid. Actually not too much for Constructed- for once, mana bases were FUN to build! :D But too much for Limited. So they say.  
  
[Ancient Tomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ancient Tomb) produces 2 mana, costs life to use, and is 0 to play. It's the flip side of Mana Crypt, with Sol Ring... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
